cards.title: VOLATILITY (VIX)
cards.tooltip: CBOE VIX close from FRED (VIXCLS). Higher = riskier.

cards.title: HIGH YIELD SPREAD (OAS)
cards.tooltip: HY OAS from FRED (ICE BofA). Higher = tighter financial conditions / more stress.

cards.title: INVESTMENT GRADE SPREAD (OAS)
cards.tooltip: IG OAS from FRED (ICE BofA). Higher = tighter conditions / credit stress.

cards.title: YIELD CURVE (10Y–2Y)
cards.tooltip: 10Y–2Y spread from FRED. More negative (inversion) = growth risk signal.

cards.title: EQUITY DRAWDOWN (SPY, 1M)
cards.tooltip: SPY drawdown from 1M peak (21 trading days). More negative = risk-off.

cards.title: REGIONAL BANKS DRAWDOWN (KRE, 3M)
cards.tooltip: KRE drawdown from 3M peak (63 trading days). More negative = bank stress proxy.

cards.title: RECESSION RISK
cards.tooltip: Composite recession risk dial (0–100). Blend: inverted curve stress (T10Y3M), Sahm Rule realtime, and smoothed recession probability. Curve is capped when labour/coincident confirmation is low.

cards.title: CREDIT STRESS
cards.tooltip: Composite credit stress dial (0–100, percentile-based). Blend of HY/BBB spreads, HY–IG repricing, CPFF funding stress, STLFSI4 and NFCIRISK. Adds a small kicker when HY spreads widen rapidly.
